get back.translation[0].definitions[0].e: I’ll talk to you when I get back.
He got back to the office just before lunchtime.
get back.translation[0].definitions[1].d: to start doing something again or talking about something again
get back.translation[0].definitions[1].e: Let’s get back to the main point of the discussion.
Well, I must get back to work.
Have you ever thought about getting back into teaching?
get back.translation[0].definitions[2].d: to change to a previous state or condition again
get back.translation[0].definitions[2].e: Life was beginning to get back to normal.
I couldn’t get back to sleep.
Do you think they’ll get back together  (=start having a relationship again)?
get back.translation[0].definitions[3].d: to get something again after you have lost it or someone else has taken it
get back.translation[0].definitions[3].e: Did you get your books back?
get back.translation[0].definitions[4].d: to do something to hurt or harm someone who has hurt or harmed you
get back.translation[0].definitions[4].e: I’ll get you back for this!
